title: Woman dies after car driven by Haryana cop runs her over
content: Some eyewitnesses alleged that the head constable was in an inebriated condition at the time of the incident

title: Assam BJP social media co-convenor removed for uploading controversial video
content: The video showed Mr. Sarma purportedly taking aim with a rifle and firing a shot at two people, one wearing a skull cap and the other with a beard, with "point-blank shot" as the caption

title: Kerala HC grants anticipatory bail to MLA Rahul Mamkootathil in first rape case
content: Bail granted on condition that MLA will appear before investigating officer on February 16 for interrogation and surrender his mobile phone

title: Protest in Visakhapatnam against central government’s anti-labour policies
content: The protesters came up with certain demands including regularisation of all contract, outsourcing, and unorganised sector workers. Workers should be paid a minimum wage of ₹26,000 along with ESI, PF, and Gratuity benefits

title: Ayurvod, the herbal liqueur from Poland, blends Ayurvedic flavours with Polish vodka
content: Ayurvod by Midhun Mohan contains around 75 ingredients, including spices such as clove, cinnamon, cardamom, among others. It recently won a gold medal at the 2025 Warsaw Spirits Competition in the herbal liqueur category

title: ED summons former Punjab CM Amarinder Singh, son in FEMA case
content: The father-son duo have been accused of being the "beneficiaries" of certain foreign assets, including a Swiss bank account

title: Bharat Bandh: Trade union strike disrupts normal life in Kerala; transport services hit
content: Public services and businesses disrupted. With transport services halted, people face significant challenges as the strike unfolded

title: Parliament Budget Session Day 11 LIVE: Lok Sabha adjourned till 12 p.m. over Opposition ruckus; RS proceedings continue
content: Opposition MPs to protest outside the Makar Dwar fon Thursday, against what has been termed as "anti-people" clauses in the Indo-U.S. trade deal

title: Bharat Bandh LIVE: Central trade unions observe nationwide strike against Centre’s ‘anti-worker’ policies
content: The forum of central trade unions claims that it has mobilised an estimated 30 crore workers for the 'general strike' to protest against the new labour codes, among other issues

title: Shivam Mishra arrested in Kanpur luxury car crash case
content: The luxury car rammed into pedestrians and vehicles in the upscale Gwaltoli area around 3 p.m. on February 8, 2026

title: Strike: Banking may be hit; transport and schools to function as usual
content: The strike, called by central trade unions and supported by organisations representing agricultural, rural, and informal sector workers, is expected to witness participation across sectors in several States

title: Four-member DGCA team visits Ajit Pawar plane crash site in Baramati
content: During their visit, they reviewed the CCTV camera footage and videos linked to the January 28 incident, said local officials.

title: Have States gained from the 16th FC? | Explained
content: What have been the recommendations of the 16th Finance Commission? What taxes are shared between the Centre and the States? Why did the last Commission revise vertical devolution to 41%? What had industrialised States such as Maharashtra, Gujarat, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka and Telangana demanded?

title: Bombay HC reduces life term of rape convict to 12 years, cites his age at time of crime, essay on Gandhiji
content: The Bench also considered certificates showing his participation in prison educational activities, including an essay competition and a programme studying the thoughts of Mahatma Gandhi

title: Union Minister Shivraj Singh Chauhan attends Janpratinidhi Sammelan in Agartala
content: The event saw inauguration of various rural development projects and beneficiary felicitation programmes

title: PM Narendra Modi’s foreign visits cost ₹462 crores in 2021-25
content: Travel to the U.S. accounts for 16% of total foreign visit expenditure in the period; Japan and France follow at nearly 9% each

title: Villagers skip meeting convened by Odisha govt over Anganwadi boycott row
content: For past three months, villagers have stopped sending their children to Anganwadi Centre where Dalit woman was appointed as helper-cum-cook

title: Construction of ‘Babri Masjid’ begins at Murshidabad
content: Bharatpur MLA Humyaun Kabir had laid the foundation stone for a mosque, modelled on Ayodhya’s Babri Masjid, on December 6, 2025.

title: Antimicrobial resistance: Charles Darwin was right; India’s drug policy isn’t
content: Antibiotics aren’t only pharmacological agents: they are evolutionary interventions that reshape microbial populations wherever they are deployed

title: Delhi High Court asks Centre to respond to plea on ‘surge’ in missing person cases
content: The petition, filed by an NGO, states that there is an “unprecedented crisis” in Delhi, with reports of more than 800 persons going missing in the first 15 days of this year

title: Anna University inaugurates state-of-the-art AI lab
content: Housed at the Technology Research Park at the University, the lab will serve as a hub for research projects, internships, workshops, hackathons, and industry-driven certification programmes

title: U.P. budget 2026: BJP’s farewell budget, lacks focus, says Opposition
content: Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav alleged that the government has not been able to spend even 50% of the previous budget so far; Congress demands white paper on project and proposal implementation

title: West Bengal BJP welcomes MHA directive of singing all stanzas of Vande Mataram
content: State BJP president Samik Bhattacharya said that it is most unfortunate if someone smells communalism in Goddess Durga

title: Protest against Ken-Betwa river link project turns violent in M.P.; 3 cases lodged
content: Locals from various villages were protesting for various demands, including the release of AAP leader Amit Bhatnagar and better compensation and rehabilitation for those affected by the project, says police

title: Haryana citizens send 11,000 suggestions to govt.’s AI-based portal for State budget
content: Suggestions concerning local self-governance or municipalities and panchayats topped the list at 750, followed by 450 on infrastructure development, and 200 on education, skill development, and employment

title: Salman Khan’s brother-in-law Aayush Sharma gets threat email
content: The sender of the email to Aayush Sharma, who is also an actor, claimed he was a member of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang, they said, without providing further details

title: KMRL gets nod to seek ₹1016-cr. loan for Kochi metro phase-2
content: Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank to offer assistance for the project; second phase will be completed in a time-bound manner, says Minister

title: Silk saree production hit in Kancheepuram
content: Since weavers did not get zari, they were unable to weave silk sarees and have not gotten their wages for over two months now

title: Kadalukku Oru Kaditham: when the sea waits for letters
content: The Directorate of Public Libraries has set up an ocean station for marine awareness; members of the public can post letters anonymously, expressing their feelings, in an effort create a connection with nature

title: Karnataka Revenue Department makes plea to High Court
content: The Revenue Department has made a proposal to the Karnataka High Court, urging it to take up auto entry of court orders in RTCs on the lines of revenue courts

title: Karnataka High Court defers cross-examination of witnesses in murder case to prevent exposure of defence strategy
content: In a ruling reinforcing fair trial rights of the accused persons in criminal cases, the Karnataka High Court has directed a trial court to defer cross-examination of a prime witness in a murder case till the examination of remaining witnesses ‘to prevent exposure of the defence strategy that may enable other witnesses to tailor their testimony’

title: Supreme Court adjourns hearing in case against T.N. CM Stalin’s 2011 poll win
content: It found a lack of structure in presentation of material particulars in Saidai Duraisamy’s pleadings accusing M.K. Stalin of corruption ahead of the 2011 Assembly poll from the Kolathur constituency

title: Supreme Court agrees to list another plea against Assam CM for alleged hate speeches
content: The petition alleged that Himanta Biswa Sarma had repeatedly made statements that incite discrimination, social and economic boycotts and violence against Bengali-origin Muslims in Assam

title: Over 13 crore disbursed for students under VIT’s scholarship scheme: Chancellor
content: On the occasion, Deputy Speaker of Tamil Nadu Legislative Assembly and chief guest K. Pitchandi distributed scholarships worth ₹28 lakh to 242 meritorious students

title: APSRTC to induct 750 electric buses in GCC mode; staff union flays move
content: Tenders for civil works at the proposed e-Bus depots are being released and the construction is likely to begin within one and a half months, says official

title: Tribal hamlets atop Jarthankollai hillock in Vellore get first bitumen road
content: DRDA officials say that the new bitumen stretch is laid between Thellai and Jarthankollai villages on the hills at a cost of ₹14.99 crore

title: Three bridges across Cheyyar river near Chengam, Polur towns inaugurated
content: The new bridges will end a detour of at least 20 kms for residents in surrounding farming villages to reach nearest towns like Polur, Arani, Chengam, and Tiruvannamalai

title: Over 800 Haj pilgrims vaccinated in Vellore, nearby districts
content: The initiative, which will be completed in these districts by Friday, is being done in coordination with the State and district Haj committees

title: Retired Navy Captain, dentist wife stabbed to death by son in Bengaluru
content: According to police, the couple’s son, Rohan Chandra Bhat, 33, a software engineer allegedly attacked both his parents with a knife following a domestic dispute.

title: A.P. Discoms told to ensure uninterrupted power supply during Sivaratri festival
content: Energy Minister asks officials to carry out preventive maintenance checks of feeders, transformers, and distribution lines to avoid power breakdowns

title: Education Ministry pushes for AI-led teaching and learning at all levels by next academic year
content: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan met with leaders of 10 leading start-ups using AI in the ed-tech sector at a roundtable discussion in IIT Delhi, ahead of the government’s Bharat Bodhan AI Conclave starting December 11

title: Brain-dead engineering student’s organs give new lease of life to several patients
content: Family consents to donation after accident; heart, liver, kidneys, lungs and corneas transplanted across Vijayawada, Guntur and Hyderabad

title: Tamil Brahmi inscriptions found in Egypt’s Valley of the Kings shed light on ancient trade links
content: Indian visitors seem to have followed an existing practice of leaving their names inside the tombs, researchers say

title: Praja Arogya Vedika seeks higher health outlay in 2026-27 Budget
content: PAV urges Ministers to raise health allocation to 2.5% of GSDP and provide an additional ₹20,000 to ₹25,000 crore, with emphasis on primary care, tribal health and strengthening publicly funded services

title: Ahead of March 31 deadline, Odisha revises surrender and rehabilitation scheme for surrendering Maoists
content: After revision of guideline in November last year that saw reward money going up substantially, 45 LWEs have surrendered before security forces while there are still 40 cadres including a State Committee Member active in Odisha

title: Amid Naravane memoir row, Defence Ministry plans fresh norms
content: The proposed guidelines for serving, retired armed forces personnel, who wish to publish books in future, will spell out the process to be followed before any manuscript is cleared for publication

title: Calling Rafale the ‘hero’ of Operation Sindoor, Vice Chief of Air Staff seeks more fighter planes for IAF
content: IAF looking to induct more new generation multi-role fighter aircraft into its fleet, says Air Marshal Kapoor; Vayu Shakti exercise at Pokhran range this month to showcase IAF’s air assets and firepower

title: Supreme Court orders completion of AAIB probe into AI-171 flight crash in three weeks
content: Air India Flight 171 crash at the Ahmedabad airport killed 12 crew members and 229 passengers on June 12 last year

title: Vande Mataram to be played before Jana Gana Mana, says Centre to States and government bodies
content: The fresh set of guidelines were uploaded on the MHA’s website on February 6 but no formal announcement or a statement was issued; it states that whenever the official version, around 3.10 minutes long, is sung or played, the audience shall stand to attention

title: Two separate landmine explosions leave soldier, civilian injured in J&K
content: An anti-personnel landmine went off at forward post Faulad, close to the LoC, in Gulmarg Sector in Baramulla; an older, similar device exploded in Poonch

title: Gunadala Matha annual fete concludes amid huge turnout
content: Solemn Eucharistic celebration marks final day as Bishop calls for equality and leaders assure development of shrine on par with Velankanni

title: Trade impact, memorials among issues raised in Rajya Sabha
content: In the Rajya Sabha, members demanded curbs on Korean mobile games, right to recall elected representatives, and Constitutional status to the National Commission for Minorities. They also discussed the impact of the India-U.S. trade deal on soybean farmers in Madhya Pradesh.

title: Bacteria can talk to each other and are multilingual, says biologist
content: The award winning scientist believes our understanding of bacterial behaviour can help in creating new therapies

title: Sharmila terms Governor’s Budget address hollow and directionless
content: PCC chief says speech repackaged manifesto, masked 19 months of governance failures and made inflated claims on investments, jobs and welfare schemes

title: Speaker can expunge any unparliamentary language, says J&K CM Omar Abdullah
content: CM apologises for his earlier remarks implying that BJP legislators had been reprimanded by the Union Home Minister, triggering an Opposition protest; CM apologises, but lashes out at LoP for his criticism of NC founder Sheikh Abdullah

title: BMTC to set up EV battery swapping stations at bus terminals across Bengaluru
content: The BMTC has identified multiple locations across the city, including Shantinagar, Domlur TTMC, Malleshwaram, Yelahanka New Town, Nagarbhavi and Vidyaranyapura, with spaces ranging from 120 to 250 sq. ft.

title: Union Minister Hardeep Puri acknowledges Epstein meetings, says Rahul Gandhi indulging in ‘innuendo, smear campaign’
content: The Union Minister said his interactions with Epstein had nothing to do with the crimes and that he had apprised Rahul Gandhi by sending a "note" last year

title: Amid heated debate, banter between Opposition and Chair
content: Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi responded gamely to the Chair of the House, the BJP’s Jagdambika Pal, who was formerly with the Congress

title: Karnataka introduces online scrutiny to prevent revenue courts from admitting cases beyond their jurisdiction
content: The government has put in place a 15-point online screening measure to prevent revenue courts from overstepping their jurisdiction

title: Curtains go up for VAIGA 2026 fest at Anayara World Market
content: Agriculture Minister underscores need for value addition in agriculture for enhancing incomes and says ryots and farmer collectives need to concentrate on entrepreneurship for making farming profitable

title: Municipal polling peaceful across the State, counting tomorrow
content: According to the State Election Commission sources, 73.01% of votes were polled. It is worth noting that the Gram Panchayat (rural local bodies) elections held in December 2025 recorded a voter turnout of over 85%

title: A.P. Food Commission member inspects anganwadi centres, issues show-cause notices
content: Lakshmi Reddy Endela directs CDPOs to issue show-cause notices to employees of Medarametla and Bodduvanipalem anganwadi centres

title: Delhi HC seeks production, sales details from Rapsodia in Anupama Dayal copyright suit
content: The Indian designer has alleged unauthorised duplication of her copyrighted works by Argentinian brand Rapsodia

title: Ravi Pillai academic scholarship will pave the way for academic development: CM
content: Pinarayi  urges students to be vigilant against attempts to promote caste-religious enmity and says students should retain their humanity to work for the good of society

title: ‘We are in match zone’: Tilak Varma fires India-Pak warning ahead of T20 WC blockbuster
content: India batter Tilak Varma expressed excitement for the upcoming ICC Men's T20 World Cup clash against Pakistan on February 15, stating the team has entered "match zone" after fixture confirmation. Varma emphasised a methodical approach, focusing on one match at a time with video analysis and adapting to wicket conditions.

title: Bihar ‘pakadua vivah’ horror: Student kidnapped by friends, drugged, forced into marriage
content: In a shocking incident from Samastipur, a 22-year-old student named Nitish Kumar was said to have been drugged and abducted by those he considered acquaintances. For two harrowing days, he was reportedly held against his will after being sedated.

title: Salesforce 'admits' CEO Marc Benioff's ICE jokes at Townhall were 'not right'
content: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff's jokes about ICE at a company event have sparked internal backlash, with employees demanding a public denouncement of the agency. The company edited the jokes from the official recording, further fueling employee frustration and an open letter calling for a stance against ICE's actions.

title: Kanpur Lamborghini crash: Days after road rampage, tobacco baron's son Shivam Mishra arrested
content: Shivam Mishra, son of tobacco baron K K Mishra, was arrested in connection with a fatal Lamborghini crash on Kanpur's VIP Road. The arrest followed the dismissal of his driver's surrender application, with the court noting Shivam was the accused. The court also directed Shivam to cooperate with the vehicle's technical examination.

title: Death of a salesman, birth of a cricketer: How Usman Tariq became Pakistan’s X-factor
content: Pakistan's mystery spinner Usman Tariq, inspired by MS Dhoni, has become a significant threat ahead of the India clash. His unique slinging action and stop-start run-up have troubled batsmen, with R Ashwin and WV Raman defending his bowling style. Indian batters, however, are expected to adapt to the challenge posed by Tariq and Pakistan's other spinners.

title: Will gold hit Rs 1.75 lakh/10 gms & silver cross Rs 3 lakh/kg soon?
content: Gold and silver price prediction: Gold and silver prices have bounced back from recent lows, and appear to be on path for a long-term rise, believes Abhilash Koikkara, Head - Forex & Commodities, Nuvama Professional Clients Group. The commodity expert shares his outlook for gold and silver in the coming sessions:

title: After Microsoft power warning, Trump may seek AI pact with big tech
content: The US government is proposing a voluntary pact with tech giants like Google and Meta to manage the booming AI data centre energy demands. Companies would commit to covering all new power generation costs, ensuring no rise in household electricity prices, and addressing water usage and local community impacts. This initiative aims to prevent grid strain and protect consumers.

title: UN report flags JeM role in Delhi Red Fort blast; warns of Masood Azhar’s women-only terror wing
content: A UN Security Council report has implicated Jaish-e-Mohammed in a car bombing near Delhi's Red Fort last November, which claimed 15 lives. The outfit's leader, Masood Azhar, reportedly established a women's wing to aid terror attacks. Investigations into the incident revealed a 'white-collar' terror module, leading to several arrests.

title: 4 promises Musk made to xAI employees after co-founders Tony Wu & Jimmy Ba quit
content: Elon Musk held an all-hands meeting with xAI employees hours after co-founders Tony Wu and Jimmy Ba announced their exits—the fifth and sixth from the 12-person founding team. Instead of addressing the departures head-on, Musk pitched a lunar satellite factory, a self-sustaining Moon city, a path to 1 billion daily active X users, and a company restructuring into four product teams. The meeting was later posted publicly on X.

title: The digital trap: How scammers turn phones into virtual prisons
content: A chilling wave of 'digital arrest' scams is sweeping India, where fraudsters impersonate officials to psychologically manipulate victims into transferring vast sums of money.  These sophisticated operations exploit fear and lack of awareness, leaving individuals financially devastated.  Authorities are working to combat this growing threat, but public vigilance remains crucial.

title: US official signals more weapon system purchases with India 'in pipeline'
content: The US is preparing to expand defense sales to India, signaling continued momentum in their strategic cooperation. Foreign Affairs Subcommittee Assistant Secretary S. Paul Kapur stated that new weapon system purchases are in the pipeline, aiming to bolster India's sovereignty and create American jobs. This comes as the two nations have also inked a trade deal, further strengthening their bilateral relationship.

title: Middle-overs stability! Spotlight on Tilak as India revisit T20 anchor debate
content: Tilak Varma embraces the anchor role in India's T20 lineup, providing stability amidst explosive hitters.  He stressed the importance of the middle overs for winning T20 games, aiming to take the game deep and finish chases.  Learning from the USA slip-up, India prioritise a settled batting order, with Varma and Suryakumar key to this strategy.

title: Doctor uses hybrid 'Tevar' to treat high-risk aneurysm case
content: A Kerala man's severe back pain revealed a life-threatening aortic aneurysm. Facing high surgical risks due to his fragile lungs, doctors opted for a staged hybrid procedure. This innovative approach rerouted blood vessels and used a stent graft, successfully treating the aneurysm and offering a lifeline to a high-risk patient.

title: Bangladesh: Day before polls, two Hindu men brutally killed in seperate incidents
content: Two Hindu men were killed in separate incidents in Bangladesh ahead of Thursday's elections. A tea worker was found dead with his hands and feet tied in Moulvibazar, while a rice trader was hacked to death in his shop in Mymensingh. The International Crisis Group has warned of further attacks.

title: CarryMinati vs Karan Johar: Court bars YouTuber from making 'defamatory' content about filmmaker
content: A Mumbai court has ordered popular YouTuber CarryMinati, real name Ajey Nagar, to cease publishing defamatory and vulgar content targeting filmmaker Karan Johar. The court also mandated social media platforms, including Meta, to remove existing videos that allegedly ridiculed Johar and harmed his reputation.

title: Saudi Arabia's early Hajj visa: Deadlines, vaccines, biometric rules & more explained
content: Saudi Arabia has started issuing Hajj 2026 visas and this early process aims to improve planning and coordination for millions of pilgrims. Muslim pilgrims can now complete documentation and health checks. Arrivals are scheduled from April 18, 2026. This proactive approach ensures a smoother and more organised pilgrimage experience for all.

title: ‘Worst of the worst criminal aliens’: 21 Gujaratis included among 89 Indians on US list
content: A US Homeland Security list of "worst of the worst" criminal aliens includes 21 Gujaratis, primarily involved in financial crimes like money laundering and fraud targeting elderly citizens. The list also features individuals convicted of sexual offenses against minors, drug trafficking, and dealing in stolen property, highlighting organized criminal activity linked to illegal migration from Gujarat.

title: From IND vs PAK in 2007 to AFG vs SA in 2026: All tied matches in T20 World Cup
content: South Africa secured a dramatic victory over Afghanistan in a thrilling double super over T20 World Cup encounter. After both teams tied at 187 in regulation and again in the first super over, South Africa ultimately prevailed in the second sudden-death showdown. Afghanistan's hopes were dashed when Rahmanullah Gurbaz was caught off the final ball.

title: ‘We have got one more day’: Tilak Varma shares big Abhishek, Bumrah fitness update
content: Tilak Varma provided positive fitness updates on Abhishek Sharma, who has been discharged from the hospital after a stomach infection, and Jasprit Bumrah, who is recovering well. Final decisions on their availability for the upcoming match against Namibia will be made closer to game time. The team is also preparing for their high-voltage encounter against Pakistan.

title: Man Utd owner says UK 'colonised' by immigrants; Brit PM demands apology
content: Sir Jim Ratcliffe’s remarks that Britain has been “colonised by immigrants” detonated far beyond a single interview because they landed at the fault line of modern British politics. Linking immigration, welfare and national decline, the Monaco-based Manchester United co-owner used loaded language and shaky numbers that triggered backlash from politicians, supporters and campaigners. Yet the episode also revealed a deeper truth: immigration anxiety now drives the UK’s political mood, fuelling the rise of Reform and hollowing out Labour’s popularity. When an establishment insider says this out loud, it signals how far the Overton window has already shifted.

title: 'Stabbed them repeatedly': US-returned Bengaluru techie kills parents in villa over startup funding
content: A US-returned techie, Rohan Chandra Bhat, has been arrested for allegedly murdering his parents in their Bengaluru villa. Driven by desperation to fund his new venture, Rohan reportedly stabbed his retired navy captain father and dentist mother after heated arguments over financial support. Neighbours alerted authorities, but the couple was declared dead at the hospital.

title: Watch: Major brawl erupts in Turkey parliament; lawmakers trade punches
content: A violent clash erupted in Turkey's parliament as opposition lawmakers attempted to prevent the swearing-in of a controversial judicial minister. The incident occurred during a cabinet reshuffle, with legislators seen pushing and punching each other. The new appointments come amid ongoing constitutional reform debates and peace initiatives.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens below 25,900; BSE Sensex down over 200 points
content: Stock market today: Indian stock market indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, tanked in opening trade on Thursday morning. While Nifty50 went below 25,900, BSE Sensex was down over 200 points.

title: Bharat Bandh today: Which sectors will be hit and why trade unions are protesting
content: Over 10 central trade unions, farmer organisations, and Left parties called for a 12-hour Bharat Bandh on Thursday, protesting against the Centre's alleged anti-worker, anti-farmer, and pro-corporate policies. The strike, supported by the Samyukt Kisan Morcha, aimed to oppose new labor codes, the Indo-US trade agreement, and changes to MGNREGA, with an estimated 30 crore workers participating across India.

title: 'Trying to isolate over 100m users': Russia blocks WhatsApp — will the ban be reversed?
content: Russia attempted to block WhatsApp and Telegram, aiming to promote domestic platforms and increase internet control. WhatsApp stated this move would isolate over 100 million users, potentially reducing safety. This action follows disputes with foreign tech firms after the Ukraine invasion, with Russia pushing its own surveillance app, MAX.

title: Bumrah yorker hits Ishan, Sanju Samson on standby for Abhishek
content: Jasprit Bumrah showed good form in training, boosting hopes for his return against Namibia. Ishan Kishan faced a brief scare after being hit by a Bumrah yorker but resumed batting. Sanju Samson is in contention if Abhishek Sharma's stomach infection persists. Washington Sundar also trained well. The team is preparing for the Pakistan clash.

title: 'Gave poisoned laddoos': How ‘mystical healer’ preyed on greed and left a trail of deaths in Delhi
content: A 72-year-old occultist, Kamruddin, has been arrested for allegedly poisoning three people with laddoos in Delhi. Cops describe him as a habitual offender with a criminal history in Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan, including at least two prior murder cases. He preyed on victims by promising mystical solutions and wealth, extorting money before administering poison.

title: Erika Kirk addresses backlash as Bad Bunny’s show outshines TPUSA event
content: Erika Kirk spoke out after Turning Point USA aired its alternative Super Bowl LX halftime show honoring her late husband, Charlie Kirk. The broadcast featured a tribute montage and patriotic performances, claiming millions of viewers despite streaming restrictions. While Bad Bunny headlined the official NFL show, the rival event blended politics, grief, and culture into a deeply emotional night.

title: Connor McDavid’s wife Lauren Kyle turns heads in Milan ahead of Olympic opener
content: Connor McDavid and Team Canada have arrived in Milan for the 2026 Winter Olympics, beginning preparations for their opener against Czechia. McDavid skated on the top line in practice and shared candid remarks about the Olympic Village and adjusting to jet lag. Off the ice, Lauren Kyle’s Instagram posts offered fans a personal look at life in Milan, highlighting family support and national pride. Canada, led by captain Sidney Crosby, aims to build on last year’s international success as Olympic competition begins.

title: Bangladesh polls: Why India is watching closely
content: Bangladesh votes Thursday in an election with significant implications for India. With Sheikh Hasina out, India hopes the frontrunner BNP can reset ties, despite historical friction. A tight contest is expected between the BNP alliance and a bloc led by Jamaat-e-Islami. India also eyes a constitutional referendum and key security concerns, including insurgent groups and Chinese influence.

title: Knicks vs 76ers injury report: Who’s playing, out and questionable
content: The Knicks and 76ers clash on February 11, 2026, impacting Eastern Conference standings. New York, near the top, faces Philadelphia battling for playoff positioning. Both teams are hampered by injuries, with key players like OG Anunoby out for the Knicks and Joel Embiid a game-time decision for the 76ers. This crucial matchup could hinge on depth and rebounding.

title: How to book Emirates flights at lower fares in 2026: Best time for booking cheapest tickets
content: Emirates' busiest January for family travel highlights the advantage of early booking. Travel experts advise booking 2-3 months ahead, especially for Economy and leveraging mid-week travel. Utilising Emirates' Low Fare Calendar and considering off-peak seasons can secure better deals. Loyalty programs and promo codes offer additional savings for savvy travellers.

title: Mavs' Flagg (foot) out for Laker game, Rising Stars
content: Mavericks rookie Cooper Flagg has a left midfoot sprain that will sideline him through All-Star Weekend, the team announced Wednesday.

title: BYU receiver Kingston charged with felony rape
content: The first-degree charge against Parker Kingston comes after a nearly yearlong investigation, the Washington County (Utah) Attorney's Office said.

title: K-State coach rips team: Don't deserve to be here
content: In a brief but tense postgame news conference, Kansas State coach Jerome Tang questioned his team's pride after a 91-62 loss to Cincinnati, saying, "These dudes do not deserve to wear this uniform."

title: KD laughs off ASG competition, jabs at Luka, Jokic
content: Kevin Durant took a playful jab at Luka Doncic, Nikola Jokic and the rest of the NBA All-Star World team when asked how hard his own U.S. squad of LeBron James and Kawhi Leonard plans to compete in the midseason showcase.

title: Porter: Roethlisberger 'not a good teammate'
content: Ex-Steelers linebacker and assistant coach Joey Porter Sr. said in a podcast last week that quarterback Ben Roethlisberger wasn't a good teammate or person.

title: UK PM demands apology from 'offensive' Ratcliffe
content: Several Manchester United supporters groups condemned comments made by co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe after the British billionaire said the U.K. has been "colonized" by immigrants.

title: Busch, 0-for-20 in Daytona 500, captures pole
content: Kyle Busch, who is winless in 20 Daytona 500 starts and hasn't started in the top five since 2016, earned the pole Wednesday night with a lap at 183.925 mph.

title: Bus carrying Iowa CC baseball team in fatal crash
content: A bus carrying the Iowa Lakes Community College baseball team crashed and rolled into a ditch Wednesday morning, killing one person and injuring the other 32 on board.

title: 🏆 2026 NFL predictions: Super Bowl, MVP, more
content: Who will win next season's Super Bowl? Who is set to be the next MVP? We asked NFL experts to make early calls on how 2026 will play out.

title: Yates' new NFL mock draft: Predicting all 32 first-round picks -- and two QB landing spots
content: Which teams might take a quarterback? Could offensive linemen dominate the first round? Field Yates projects the top 32 picks of the 2026 NFL draft.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Chloe Kim goes for snowboarding history, U.S. men's hockey team takes the ice and more
content: On Thursday at the Winter Olympics, Chloe Kim has the chance to become the first snowboarder to win three straight Olympic gold medals.

title: Women's Power Rankings: A big week for the top of the Big 12
content: Baylor, up five spots in our rankings, is once again atop the Big 12, with WVU, Texas Tech and TCU not far behind.

title: Who wins the Olympic men's hockey tournament? Intel on all 12 countries
content: The NHL is back at the Olympics! Here are the top players to know, each team's medal chances and schedule, and much more.

title: Lapsed fan's guide to the men's hockey tournament
content: Just tuning in to hockey again for the first time in a long time? Get caught up here with all the key intel.

title: From a 6-foot-7 outfielder to a 5-foot-7 spark plug: One player to watch in spring training for all 30 MLB teams
content: From prospects with big expectations to All-Stars returning from injury, here's who we're paying attention to.

title: Wetzel: Giannis/Kalshi deal does NBA no favors
content: All this might be legal, but at some point perception defines reality and optics overwhelm everything.

content: Manchester City did their job beating Fulham to stay in the Premier League title race, but can Arsenal do the same thing against Brentford?

title: Premier League's 50 worst transfers of all time: Who is No. 1?
content: All right: We've covered the best deals in PL history, but what makes a bad deal? Whatever the reasons behind them, here are the 50 worst since the league began in 1992.

title: 10 teams, 12 quarterbacks, no great options: Sorting the lackluster NFL quarterback market
content: There are no surefire free agent QBs available this March, and the draft class has only one first-round lock. So what now for teams that might need a quarterback?

title: Men's Bracketology: Who's a lock and who's on the bubble?
content: Right now, it's about looking beyond UNC's numbers and taking into account the context that has the Tar Heels as a 4-seed.

title: Women's Bracketology: Bubble trouble for the ACC?
content: The ACC and Big 12 will have a say in the field's final teams. For now, the Last Four In all hail from the ACC.

title: Chris Gotterup's meteoric rise to the top of the PGA Tour
content: Gotterup heads to Pebble Beach as one of the hottest golfers on the PGA Tour, rising all the way to No. 5 in the world golf rankings.

content: The PGA Tour brings us to Pebble Beach, where looks can be deceiving as far as course difficulty goes.

title: World Baseball Classic odds: Team USA favored over Japan, Dominican Republic
content: Odds for all 20 teams to win their pool group and to win the World Baseball Classic, which begins March 6.

title: How WNBA's expansion Tempo are working to become 'Canada's team' and unify country
content: The Carter effect helped popularize the NBA in Canada. The Tempo hope to similarly supercharge women's basketball.

title: Topps' 75th anniversary set gives fans a chance to pull iconic baseball cards
content: For the 75th anniversary, a panel of executives, journalists and collectors selected the 75 best Topps cards of all time and inserted corresponding redemption cards into their latest release.

title: Myles Garrett on hand to support girlfriend Chloe Kim's Olympic gold medal chase
content: Garrett and Kim had a hilarious debate over which of them was more dominant in their respective sport.

title: Super Bowl runner-up rings: What NFL players really think
content: Some conference championship rings fetch big bucks. Others wind up collecting dust on a closet shelf. Players share mixed opinions on the NFL's sparkly consolation prize.

title: NASCAR descends on Daytona eager to move on from turbulent offseason, get back to racing
content: It was a heartbreaking offseason for much of NASCAR, and as the garage descends on Daytona, the stock car world is ready to refocus on racing.

title: ESPN's first points-league mock draft for 2026
content: Check out the results of our first fantasy baseball head-to-head points mock draft of 2026, featuring round-by-round picks and a snapshot of the rosters of all 10 teams.

content: Eric Karabell keeps tabs on the baseball world and tells you what is relevant to fantasy baseball managers.

title: Brandon Figueroa rises after upset win over Nick Ball

title: Bangladesh Election 2026 LIVE: Clashes Reported Between Jamaat, BNP Supporters In Dhaka As Bangladesh Votes
content: Bangladesh General Election 2026 LIVE Updates: Bangladesh is voting for a crucial national election today, the first since the July 2024 uprising that ended former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's 15 years of iron-fisted rule.

title: Parliament Budget Session Day 12 Live Updates: Privilege Motion Against Rahul Gandhi Likely
content: Parliament Budget Session LIVE Updates, Day 12: The BJP is likely to move a privilege motion against Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi, sources claimed, a day after the Congress MP's speech.

title: Fake Police Sign, Gandhi Photo: How Scammers In Cambodia "Arrested' Indians
content: Fake signboards with logos of the Mumbai police and CBI, with pictures of Mahatma Gandhi and BR Ambedkar on either side, were found inside an abandoned compound used by scammers for "digital arrest" operations in Cambodia.

title: "No Re-Entry To Matrimonial Home If...": 81-Year-Old Woman's Plea Rejected
content: Delhi High Court has ruled that the Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act, 2005, does not grant an indefeasible right to an aggrieved woman to insist on residing in a particular property that she had earlier left.

title: Trump To Undo Legal Basis For US Climate Rules
content: President Donald Trump is poised to revoke a landmark scientific finding that greenhouse gases endanger public health by driving climate change -- a determination that underpins US regulations aimed at curbing planet-warming pollution.

title: Bharat Bandh Today: How Will Banks, Buses, Educational Institutes Be Affected
content: Bharat Bandh, a nationwide strike called by major trade unions and farmers' organisations, is underway.

title: Yale Professor Recommended 'Good-Looking' Student To Epstein. He's Not Sorry
content: Newly released documents show a Yale professor sent Jeffrey Epstein an email describing an undergraduate as a good-looking blonde while recommending her for a job.

title: Gold And Silver Prices Continue Upward Trend: Check Rates On February 12
content: Silver prices increased by Rs 10,000 to Rs 2.63 lakh per kg, while gold increased by Rs 1,000 to Rs 1.59 lakh per 10 grams.

title: US To Start Payments Towards Billions Owed To UN 'Within Weeks': Envoy
content: Washington will begin making initial payments towards the billions of dollars it owes the United Nations "within weeks", while continuing to push for reforms, the US ambassador to the UN said.

title: Hyderabad-Bound Gulf Air Flight Gets Bomb Threat Minutes After Takeoff
content: An e-mail received on Wednesday threatened a blast at the Hyderabad airport when a Gulf Air flight from Bahrain lands, according to sources.

title: Czech Woman Tourist Assaulted In Goa, Accused Arrested
content: A 22-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly assaulting a woman tourist from the Czech Republic at Agonda Beach in Goa's Kushavati district, police said on Thursday.

title: S Korea Fines Louis Vuitton, Dior, Tiffany $24.9 Million Over Data Leaks
content: South Korea's privacy watchdog said on Thursday it has fined the Korean units of luxury brands Louis Vuitton, Dior and Tiffany a combined 36 billion won ($24.9 million) over leaks of customer information.

title: Drugs Worth Rs 3.43 Crore Seized By Customs At Bengaluru Airport
content: The Bengaluru Customs officials have announced that narcotic substances worth over Rs 3.43 crore were seized at the Kempegowda International Airport in two separate incidents.

title: Donald Trump Praises Trade Deal With India, Calls It "Historic"
content: US President Donald Trump said that the United States is the world's leading energy producer, emphasising the nation is becoming a "massive energy exporter."

title: Canada School Killer, 18-Year-Old Trans Woman, First Shot Mother, Step-Brother At Home
content: Canada Shooter Jesse Van Rootselaar: An 18-year-old trans woman with mental health issues has been identified as the killer behind the deadly shooting in British Columbia, Canada, that resulted in nine deaths.

title: Jamaat, BNP Supporters Clash In Dhaka As Bangladesh Votes: 10 Updates
content: Clashes have been reported between Jamaat and Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) supporters in Mirpur-10 Constituency in Dhaka. Jamaat-e-Islami chief Shafiqur Rahman is contesting from this seat. Voting is underway on 299 seats in Bangladesh.

title: Video: Excavator Machine Operator Tries To Strike Indore Man Amid Argument

title: UN Report Flags Jaish-e-Mohammed Link To Red Fort Attack, Warns of New Women's Terror Wing
content: A United Nations counter-terrorism monitoring team has named Pakistan-based terror group Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) as being linked to a deadly attack at Delhi's historic Red Fort.

title: Gates Foundation Says It Did Not Make Any Payments To Jeffrey Epstein
content: The Gates Foundation said it did not make any financial payments to late financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein or employ him at any time.

title: Why Some Animals Are Still Labelled As Primitive Though None Exist
content: We humans have long viewed ourselves as the pinnacle of evolution. People label other species as "primitive" or "ancient" and use terms like "higher" and "lower" animals.
